html:
B&H Photo has the Angelbird 160GB AV PRO CFexpress 2.0 Type B SX memory card in their DealZone for $89 (Reg $139) today. Angelbird is a highly regarded maker of memory cards and this is a great deal for a high capacity card.

Purchase

  • Angelbird 160GB AV PRO CFexpress 2.0 Type B SX $89 (Reg $139)

Overview

  • 160GB Storage Capacity
  • PCIe 3.0 x2 Bus
  • Max Read Speed: 1785 MB/s
  • Sustained Read Speed: 1785 MB/s
  • Max Write Speed: 1600 MB/s
  • Sustained Write Speed: 1480 MB/s
  • Moisture, X-Ray, Shock & Dust Resistant
  • Can Withstand Temperature Extremes
  • Y2 Processor and Stable Stream
  • Advanced Thermal Management

Designed for photographers and videographers looking to tap the speed benefits of advanced camera systems, including the Canon EOS-1D X MARK III and Nikon Z 9, the 160GB AV PRO CFexpress 2.0 Type B SX Memory Card from Angelbird supports non-stop, continuous high-speed shooting for high-definition frames in 8K+ raw.

It provides maximum read speeds of 1785 MB/s and maximum write speeds of 1600 MB/s, as well as sustained read speeds of 1785 MB/s and sustained write speeds of 1480 MB/s. Thanks to Stable Stream technology, write speeds won’t throttle or drop while recording video or shooting continuous image bursts.

Built for extreme conditions, Angelbird’s 160GB AV PRO CFexpress SX Memory Card is protected against moisture, x-rays, shock, dust, and temperatures ranging from -14 to 185°F. Also featured is Angelbird’s Y2 processor, advanced thermal management, adaptive power management, host power loss protection, hardware and software data recovery, free engraving, and more.

To receive the full limited 3-year warranty, the product needs to be registered on the Angelbird Personal Service Portal within 30 days after purchase. If not registered within this period, the market-specific legal guarantee period comes into force.

Purchase

  • Angelbird 160GB AV PRO CFexpress 2.0 Type B SX $89 (Reg $139)

When you purchase through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Here's how it works.

Craig is the founder and editorial director for Canon Rumors. He has been writing about all things Canon for more than 17 years. When he's not writing, you can find him shooting professional basketball and travelling the world looking for the next wildlife adventure. The Canon EOS R1 is his camera of choice.
